data.title: Trouble experience
data.text:
Food was ok, the server was nice but did not put our order in (forgot to hit the send button). We waited for over an hour before we got served and she brought us the wrong thing. It was so late that we just ate what she brought.  The thing that got me was that she did not make any adjustments on the bill. Actually charged us for coffee that we decided to have.

Should have explained TIPS- to insurance prompt service. We left a tip and probably shouldn't have. 

Would not recommend.... signed a big foodie

data.title: Good and big portions
data.text:
Spaghetti with meatballs are the best!
Also ravioli... 
And low prices!
And they give us homemade bread for free!

data.title: Yummmm
data.text: Very good pizza, but only if you order it by the slice. Whole pizza tends to run to soggy. Ordered the hot wings and it was more like boiled wings and not much hot sauce to speak of.If you love hot wings, then save your money.

data.title: Best Pizza, Best Pasta!
data.text: Great food and friendly staff! Yummy. Pizza dough& sauce is made from scratch.  The marinara, Alfredo, pesto, & rose sauces are made by hand & fresh every day.!!

data.title: Hope I don't get sick
data.text:
We returned to Evelyn's after 6 months out of state. I don't return visit often, but had previously enjoyed.
Tonight was AWFUL! Seafood pasta, undercooked noodles, ? Was it a cream sauce or a water sauce? Seafood,risky!!! Maybe spoiled.
Pasta fagioli tasteless. Bread burnt on the bottom. The miss behaving children at the next table didn't help. But, maybe they had to wait forever for their food also.?

data.title: This Pizza Lovers Favorite Pizza
data.text:
My wife says given the opportunity, I'd eat pizza seven days a week and she might be right ! For now I limit my pizza intake to one or two nights per week. "Evelyn's BIG Italian is always the source, my favorite is the "Pesto Sauce Pizza with Mushrooms and Italian Sausage" with "Pepperoni & Garlic" a close second.
Last October we moved from Fairfield to Vallejo but I still go to Evelyn's BIG Italian for Pizza, for me it's well worth the drive !

data.title: Great lunch specials
data.text: My wife and I came here for Sunday lunch.  It's was our first time here.  We enjoyed the food and the atmosphere.  The food portions were plenty large enough- we ended up taking leftovers home!  For baked dishes, it takes a while to come out, so you may want to consider an appetizer.  Non baked food, pizza and soup came out fast.  We had a sweet dessert (mascarpone) with coffee - give it a try if you have room for dessert!

data.title: Decent Pizzeria, Variable Quality
data.text:
We've been going to Evelyn's since it opened and to New York Pizza Kitchen in its previous incarnation. The service is always very good but what comes out of the kitchen these days varies a fair amount. 

When they were NYPK the pizza was consistently very good and tasty. When they moved to the current location several things happened. First the crust had less taste all of a sudden like an ingredient was left behind when they moved. Second the pizzas became less consistent. Sometimes over cooked, sometimes fine. You can never tell. I suspect it may be related to Piero's involvement. At NYPK he was pretty much always there and demanded excellence from the kitchen staff. We haven't seen him in the kitchen for some time so they may be running open loop. 

It's a fine local pizzeria but be prepared for variance in what you get. Cheers!

data.title: First time I tried it, I was hooked.
data.text: I wondered into downtown Fairfield just because I had never been there before and was hungry and was looking for something off the chain-beaten path on I-80. I passed the Big Italian Pizzeria and thought, mmmm, maybe they have good ravioli! The decor is along the lines of what I remember from growing up in an Italian neighborhood, baseball momentos, fun stuff on the walls, then comes the spectacular crusty bread, olive oil and vinegar. And yes, the ravioli is grand. I had the spinach ravioli and found it to be really tasty. I came back with family in tow after a road trip and we had a sampling of everything, pizza, ravioli, baked ziti, all washed down with house wine. Oh, yea, despite all of us stuffing our chops completely, we took home enough leftovers for my lunch for 3 days! Spectacular to find such good Italian cooking tucked away in Fairfield. We'll be back!

data.title: Deliciously Authentic Neapolitan Food
data.text: Do not be put off by first impressions as you enter this wonderful casual dining spot. The folks here are genuinely passionate about producing deliciously prepared Southern Italian food. Upon arrival, diners may think they have stepped right into a New York pizzeria with a tiny dining room and an "order and pay here" neon sign at the far end! But there is actually a large, quiet dining room around the corner where efficient table service is provided. All house made, every morsel of the meals here is delicious. Pasta in many varieties, salad, pizza, eggplant parm and eggplant rollatini are a few of the yummy offerings. Accompanied by homemade bread warm from the oven, our meal was heavenly!

data.title: A slice of New York in Norcal.
data.text: The first time I walked into this place, I immediately had flashback sense memories of visits to New York City, the place of my fathers birth and early life.  There is something special about this little place that I can't put my finger on that keeps me coming back. Their dinner menu selections are enormous proportions that will easily feed two people. They have a selection of the usual Italian dishes and up to 32 inch pizzas. They also sell slices of pizza which compare well with the best I have ever had. When you order a slice, you get a piece of pizza that is enough for a meal. They make the slices from large pizzas they have already cooked, but reheat in the oven with your choice of fresh ingredients. This makes the crust absolutely delectable! Oddly, the crust is not as good on whole pies.  They are a bit heavy handed in how they make many of their dishes, but that just makes them characteristic of this restaurant.

data.title: Yummy Pizza!
data.text: They serve enormous portions of everything! Their pizza taste the best! As for their pasta, I'm not too sure about it. I ordered their spaghetti with meatballs and it didn't have any flavor. Bland. According to my husband he loves their strambolis(sp?).

data.title: Pizza Pizza
data.text: Used to be better. They changed their crust.  They have very slow service.  Did I say they have very slow service. Slow enough to walk out...

data.title: Perfect Dining In experience
data.text: Pizza is great!  Good flavor.  Most pizza places I've been to don't get the crust consistency right, in my opinion.  Dining in gives me the opportunity to get the perfect pizza experience.  The bottom and the end crust is the right consistency for me--crisp, not soggy.  I purchased a large once to bring to work, and I wasn't prepared to store it anywhere but on a seat of my car.  If I had thought ahead and cleared out the cargo space, I wouldn't of had to suspend the box over the back of the passenger and the top of the back seat of my Jeep Compass.

data.title: Very good
data.text: This was a pretty good italian restaurant.  Nothing spectacular.  But everything was fresh and prepared well.  We'd come back.

data.title: Great local pizzeria!
data.text: This is authentic!! If you go during lunch you might want to call ahead and order it to go! It is one of the busiest places downtown and for a good reason, the food and value is wonderful!!

data.title: Great Marinara
data.text: I went to Evelyn's right after it opened as part of my continuing quest for a great plate of spaghetti and meatballs.  Their marinara sauce is excellent, and the meatballs are good, too.  I've been a steady spaghetti customer ever since.

data.title: Lots of Food
data.text: Just had eggplant Parmesan my husband had lasagne. We shared a large salad, it was all delish. We took half home for another meal. Their bread is served warm and fresh. Great pizza also. You order at entrance and find a place to sit but Sunday early it was not as crowded so we were seated and waited on. Great flavor and reasonable prices.

data.title: Great food
data.text:
If you find this helpful please click helpful below.

The food was just okay, the service was nothing spectacular, the italian was more of an american / chain not so fresh type of Italian.  It was by no means bad, just we are spoiled in the Northeast.

I would come back, it was reasonable in price... Just dont expect top food.

data.title: Evelyn's is the first choice for Italian Food in Fairfield
data.text:
There are a few Italian restaurants to eat at in the Napa, Fairfield, area (I mention those two places because I work in one, Napa, and I live in the other, Fairfield).
This is one of the first places I have been where there is a separate dining room for adults only. We do not have any small children and do not want to hear them screaming or whining while eating. So the fact that Evelyn's has a separate dining area for adults only is very refreshing!
The food, what to say about the food except this is Italian comfort food. When you order the portions are very large! But the food is very good! Everyone seems to come for just the pizza, but you haven't experienced the great food until you order off the menu.
